bibl.title: Letter to Henry M. Robinson, January 7, 1942

div1.p: The writer sends Hench's article on yellow fever for consideration by "Reader's Digest."

div1.head: Letter to Henry M. Robinson, January 7, 1942
div1.opener:
January 7, 1942
Mr. Henry M. Robinson
2 Bookman Place
New York, New York
Dear Robinson:
div1.p:
You probably have seen the article on yellow fever by Dr.
Hench, but because one of the doctors around here thought you
might be interested in using it in the “Readers Digest,” I am
sending on a reprint. Dr. Hench has been spending a lot of time
in the last few years hunting up Kissinger and the other survivor
of Walter Reed's experiments. He has also gone to Cuba and run
down all the information he could get there and has brought to
light a number of very interesting facts which hitherto were un-
known except to a few individuals. He has also recently discovered
Lazear's notebook, which contains a lot of notes by Walter Reed.
When that is edited, more information may come out than we had
before.
